B184gcnI.question:
The automatic power control system (autothrottle) of a transport airplane has the following mode(s):
1) capture and holding of speeds.
2) capture and holding of Mach number.
3) capture and holding of flight angle of attack.
4) capture and holding of N1 or EPR (Engine Power Ratio).
5) capture and holding of flight paths.
The combination regrouping all the correct statements is:

K86XOTXh.question: In a modern large transport aircraft...

options.text: N1 is adjusted automatically as aircraft climbs
N1 and N2 are adjusted as aircraft climbs
N1 is adjusted automatically and N2 is adjusted manually
N1 is adjusted manually and N2 is adjusted automatically

HnefeIyw.question: What is the main purpose of the autothrottle on take-off?

options.text: To set and hold a commanded thrust setting.
To hold a speed once airborne.
To hold an attitude after take off.
To constantly adjust the thrust on the take off roll.

JNlDOF5q.question:

1. SPEED 
2. N1 
3. THR IDLE 
4. TOGA 
5. V/S

options.text: 2, 3, and 4 only
3 and 4 only
1 and 5 only
the Autothrottle system is not used.
the Autothrottle protects against hot start.
the Autothrottle protects against wet start.
the Autothrottle uses ambient conditions to assist starting.

1 – armed.2 – active.3 – disconnected.

the Autothrottle protects against hot start.
the Autothrottle uses ambient conditions to assist starting.

ZyIaMaOq.question: Why is autothrust NOT used in severe turbulence?

options.text: The autothrust may overcompensate in an oscillating manner.

The aircraft may exceed its never exceed speed due to autothrust inputs.

options.text: None of the states listed above.
